news_title_translate_en: Factbox: WHO expert panel to decide whether new virus is an emergency
news_title_translate_cn: 世界卫生组织专家小组决定新病毒是否为紧急情况
news_content_translate_en:
GENEVA (Reuters) - A World Health Organisation panel of experts on the new coronavirus met on Thursday to evaluate whether the outbreak, which has spread from China to several countries, constitutes an international emergency.
The 16 independent experts in disease control, virology, epidemiology and vaccine development were holding a second closed-door meeting at the U.N. agency’s headquarters in Geneva after not reaching a decision on Wednesday.
Didier Houssin, an adviser to France’s national health security agency, is serving as chair. Chinese health authorities made a presentation by teleconference and have allowed a WHO team into the country who are due to report back to the panel.
A news conference was expected later in the day.
Here are some facts about WHO Emergency Committees:
- Director general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus announced on Monday that the WHO had called an Emergency Committee to assess the outbreak of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) that began in the Chinese city of Wuhan at the end of last year.
- Declaration of a Public Health Emergency of International Concern - known as a “PHEIC” in WHO jargon - is rare.
- The WHO panel’s recommendations, after assessing any evidence of human-to-human transmission and other factors, would  be put to Tedros, who would decide whether to declare an emergency.
- Only five emergencies have been declared in the past decade: the H1 virus that caused an influenza pandemic (2009), West Africa’s Ebola outbreak, polio (2014), Zika virus (2016), and the ongoing Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019).
- The WHO’s criteria, laid out in the 2005 International Health Regulations, define a PHEIC as “an extraordinary event which is determined to constitute a public health risk to other states through the international spread of disease and to potentially require a coordinated international response”
.
- Such situations are “serious, sudden, unusual or unexpected”, carry cross-border implications and may require immediate international action, its rules say.
- A declaration would lead to boosting public health measures, funding and resources to prevent and reduce international spread.
- It could include recommendations on trade and travel, including airport screening of passengers, although the WHO generally aims to avoid disruptive trade restrictions.
news_content_translate_cn:
日内瓦（路透社）-世界卫生组织新冠状病毒专家小组星期四开会，评估从中国蔓延到几个国家的疫情是否构成国际紧急情况。
这16位疾病控制、病毒学、流行病学和疫苗研发方面的独立专家在周三没有做出决定后，正在日内瓦联合国机构总部举行第二次闭门会议。
法国国家卫生安全局顾问迪迪埃·霍森担任主席。中国卫生当局通过电话会议作了介绍，并允许世卫组织的一个小组进入中国，他们将向专家组报告。
预计当天晚些时候将举行新闻发布会。
以下是世卫组织紧急委员会的一些事实：
-世界卫生组织总干事特德罗·阿达诺姆·盖布雷耶苏周一宣布，世卫组织已召集紧急委员会评估去年年底在中国武汉市爆发的新型冠状病毒（2019年nCoV）疫情。
-宣布出现国际关注的公共卫生紧急情况（世卫组织术语称之为“PHEIC”）是罕见的。
-世卫组织专家组的建议，在评估任何人与人之间传播的证据和其他因素后，将提交给特德罗斯，由特德罗斯决定是否宣布紧急情况。
-在过去十年中，仅宣布了五种紧急情况：导致流感大流行的H1病毒（2009年）、西非埃博拉疫情、小儿麻痹症（2014年）、寨卡病毒（2016年）和刚果民主共和国正在爆发的埃博拉疫情（2019年）。
-2005年《国际卫生条例》中规定的世卫组织标准将PHEIC定义为“一种特殊事件，它被确定通过疾病的国际传播对其他国家构成公共卫生风险，并可能需要国际上的协调应对。”
.
-其规则称，这种情况是“严重的、突然的、不寻常的或出乎意料的”，具有跨境影响，可能需要立即采取国际行动。
-一项宣言将导致加强公共卫生措施、资金和资源，以防止和减少国际传播。
-它可以包括关于贸易和旅行的建议，包括对乘客进行机场检查，尽管世卫组织的总体目标是避免破坏性的贸易限制。

According to the responsible party, "the Commission is ready to take whatever precautions are necessary to comply with the recommendations of the World Health Organisation (WHO) adopted at today's meeting" of that entity.
Stefan de Keersmaecker specified that, this morning, the European Commissioner for Health, Stella Kyriakides, talked to the WHO Director-General and the French and Italian Health Ministers about this virus.
In addition, according to this spokesman, internal meetings are taking place in the European Commission on the subject.
"Yesterday [Wednesday], the Commission held a second meeting of the public health committee, which discussed the level of risk and potential consequences for the EU", exemplified Stefan de Keersmaecker.
The virus is still being monitored by the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, a European body that identifies health threats and that has "increased the risk of this virus entering the EU from bottom to moderate", said the spokesman, explaining that this was due to the risk of transmission from person to person.
The new virus causing viral pneumonias was detected in China at the end of 2019 and has already infected several hundred people and caused death to at least 17.
This is a new type of coronavirus, which is transmitted between animals and passed on to humans, and there are already records of transmission from person to person, but also under totally unjustified circumstances.
Yeah.
The first cases of the 2019-nCoV virus appeared in mid-December in the Chinese town of Whuan, when people with a viral pneumonia began to arrive at hospitals. It was found that all people were often working or visiting Huanan's seafood and meat market in the same city. The exact origin of the infection is still unknown, but it would have been infected animals, which are marketed alive, transmitting it to humans.
Symptoms of these coronaviruses ar e more intense than flu and include fever, pain, general malaise and respiratory distress, including shortness of breath.

news_title_translate_en: Third Chinese city placed under quarantine to contain propagation of the coronavirus

news_content_translate_en:

But he decided not to immediately make that statement and wait to observe the evolution of the virus.

news_title_translate_en: Beijing cancels Chinese New Year celebrations to contain coronavirus spread
news_title_translate_cn: 北京取消春节庆祝活动遏制冠状病毒传播
news_content_translate_en:
New Year's vacation began on Friday and lasts for a week.
Traditionally, the inhabitants of Beijing gather by the hundreds of thousands in the parks and gardens of the capital to attend traditional dragon and lion dances.
The measure is intended to contain the epidemic of a new type of coronavirus that appeared last month in the city of Wuhan (centre) and spread to other cities and countries, infecting hundreds of people.
The vast majority of 571 cases diagnosed in China were in Wuhan, an industrial and transport hub in Hubei Province.
Other cases were diagnosed in Macao, Hong Kong, Japan, South Korea, Thailand, Taiwan and the United States, mostly in people who had been to Wuhan.
The cancellation of New Year's festivities in Beijing follows other measures to contain the virus, such as the ban on entry and exit of three Wuhan cities (11 million inhabitants), Huanggang (7,5 million) and Ezhou (one million).
news_content_translate_cn:
新年假期从星期五开始，持续一周。
传统上，北京的居民聚集在首都的公园和花园里，参加传统的舞龙舞狮。
这项措施旨在遏制上个月在武汉市（中）出现的一种新型冠状病毒的流行，并蔓延到其他城市和国家，感染数百人。
在中国确诊的571例病例中，绝大多数在湖北省的工业和交通枢纽武汉。
其他病例在澳门、香港、日本、韩国、泰国、台湾和美国确诊，大多是在去过武汉的人身上。
在取消北京的新年庆祝活动之前，武汉市（1100万居民）、黄冈市（750万居民）和鄂州市（100万居民）也采取了其他措施来遏制病毒。

news_title_translate_en: The epidemic situation or out of control anxiety increased in Wuhan

news_content_translate_en:
Announcement No.1 of Wuhan epidemic headquarters announced that: from 10:00 on January 23, 2020, the city's public transport, subway, ferry and long-distance passenger transport were suspended; without special reasons, citizens should not leave Wuhan. The passage for the airport and railway station to leave Wuhan is temporarily closed. The recovery time will be announced separately. The announcement said that the move was aimed at containing the spread of the new coronavirus epidemic and ensuring the safety of the people.
At this time, it has been more than a month since unknown pneumonia broke out in the seafood market of Wuhan. The deadly virus from the game stall in the seafood market mutated rapidly, spread among people, spread to other provinces and countries in China, and the epidemic in Wuhan seems to be out of control.
Chinese authorities said there was no evidence of "human to human" transmission for more than a month, until epidemiologist Zhong Nanshan went to Wuhan to investigate, and earlier this week announced on CCTV that the virus could be "human to human". Then the number of officially announced infections doubled in two days, to more than 500, and the number of officially recognized deaths increased from three to 17.
According to some analysis, the actual number of infections may be more, because some patients are not included in the hospital statistics. For example, the field survey of Sanlian weekly quoted a nurse as saying that many hospitals do not accept pneumonia patients in the seafood market. Huang Chang, a dishonest seafood market owner, said his discharge did not indicate the new coronavirus pneumonia.
The day before Wuhan authorities announced the decision, a Chinese netizen revealed that academician Zhong Nanshan believed that the outbreak would be more dangerous than SARS in 2003 The high incidence period is expected to be from the end of February to the end of March. He suggested that Wuhan should be closed down and was rejected by the leaders concerned. As a result, he decided not to take any more media interviews.
Wuhan's anxiety is gradually rising. St é phane Lagarde, a special reporter of RFI from France and Guangzhou, today reported from Wuhan that Hankou, a coffee bar, a shop and a hotel at the intersection of the Han River and the Yangtze River are empty. South China's seafood market has been blocked and monitored after the outbreak of the virus, and other agricultural markets have been closed since this week. A young man said, "yes, of course I'm afraid, because as soon as you get hot, then you can't breathe.".
In a skating rink in a business center, there is only one little girl playing. Cheerwin, a young woman at the reception counter, said the situation in Hankou was more serious these days. Parents stopped taking their children out of the house, fearing that their children might catch the virus
。 At present, she is not afraid. She thinks that if children can come to the skating rink, they are healthy, so there is no need to worry.

news_title_translate_en: Singapore confirms first case of Wuhan virus
news_title_translate_cn: 新加坡确诊武汉病毒第一例
news_content_translate_en:
SINGAPORE - A China national has tested positive for the Wuhan virus in Singapore, with another likely to have the virus. 
 The 66-year-old man, a Wuhan resident, arrived in Singapore with nine travelling companions on Monday (Jan 20), and stayed at Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa resort, the Ministry of Health said at a briefing on Thursday night (Jan 23). 
 All the rooms at the hotel where the man and his travelling companions stayed in have been sanitised and sealed off. 
 A 53-year-old woman, also a China national but not travelling with the group, has come up positive in preliminary tests, which are awaiting confirmation. 
 In addition, the man's son, 37, is a suspected case and has also been warded, while his other eight travelling companions have left Singapore. MOH said it has contacted the authorities of their destination country. 
 However, there was no evidence that the virus had spread to anyone here, the ministry said. 
 After widening the net to include screening of temperatures of all air travellers from China, the number of suspected cases in Singapore has increased. 
 The ministry said that in total, it has had 28 suspected cases aged one to 78 years. Seven people have been cleared. 
 "All measures will be taken to contain its possible spread," said the ministry's director of communicable diseases, Associate Professor Vernon Lee. 
 More cases are expected, he added, given the large number of cases in China and high travel volume from the country to Singapore. 
 As for the first case here, he had already been isolated and was no longer a risk to the public, he stressed. 
 "There's no need for general public to panic or do any special measures." 
 Close contacts of confirmed cases will be quarantined. 
 On Thursday, as part of measures to shore up defences against the virus, the newly-formed multi-ministry task force met for the first time, and decided to enhance border control and intensify border screening
. 
 This will be expanded to land and sea checkpoints by Friday morning. 
 The virus, now known as 2019-nCoV, can now be passed from person to person, has already killed 17 people and infected at least 540 throughout China, with cases also surfacing in Taiwan, Japan, Macau, Thailand, Vietnam and the United States. 
 Guests seen wearing masks at Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort and Spa on Jan 23, 2020. ST PHOTO: TIMOTHY DAVID 
 The Chinese health authorities have so far been unable to determine the origin of the virus but they say the new virus, which has no vaccine, is mutating and spreading. 
 Infections are expected to spike over the Chinese New Year weekend as a large number of travellers travel to and from, as well as within, China. 
 MOH on Thursday night also expanded its travel advisory, saying that Singaporeans should avoid travel to the whole of Hubei Province, in the light of the travel restrictions that China has imposed on the Hubei cities of Huanggang and Ezhou. 
 Earlier in the day, the ministry urged people to avoid travelling to Wuhan only. Wuhan is also in Hubei province. 
 The ministry also advised Singaporeans to continue to exercise caution and pay attention to personal hygiene when travelling to the rest of China. 
 MOH has said that all travellers should monitor their health closely for two weeks upon return to Singapore and seek medical attention promptly if they feel unwell. They should also inform their doctors of their travel history. 
 The ministry has also advised people not to travel to Wuhan, the epicentre of the outbreak. 
 It has asked travellers to avoid contact with live animals and the consumption of raw or undercooked meats, and to observe good personal hygiene. 
 Temperature screening at Changi Airport was expanded to cover all inbound travellers on flights arriving from China since Wednesday. 
 - Additional reporting by Aw Cheng Wei

news_content_translate_en:
Beijing, January 23. /tass/ The most likely vector of the recent outbreak of coronavirus pneumonia in Wuhan, China is snake. That's the conclusion of the researchers, who published a scientific journal, the Journal of medical psychology.
According to the report of the World Health Organization (who) on December 31, 2019, unknown viral pneumonia broke out in Wuhan, central China. Chinese experts have found that the disease can lead to new types of coronaviruses, 2019 ncov isolated cases have been found in other Asian countries - Japan, South Korea, Thailand, Vietnam, Singapore and the United States. Now, 17 people have died and more than 600 people have been infected.
To more accurately determine where the new coronavirus came from, experts compared five genetic samples with more than 200 other virus samples. They concluded that 2019 ncov is a mixture of two coronavirus species, one of which was previously found in bats. The second virus was not found before. The mix appeared about two years ago.
In addition, experts also found that snake is the most likely vehicle among 2019 ncov vehicles. This is the result of the statistical analysis of the DNA structure of Colorado virus.
About According to the researchers, reptiles are transmitted by bats, resulting in a hybrid coronavirus that later entered the human body.
Scientists call two reptiles (Naja atra) and several dragons (crabs) in southern China carriers of the new virus. Experts believe that the source of these products may be the closed wholesale market in Huang An City, which sells snakes and bats.
Previously, experts have put forward a hypothesis about the possible sources of Russia 2019-ncov. Georgi bashekin, chief of the molecular evolution section of the information transmission Research Institute of the Russian Academy of Sciences, told TASS that they might be bats.

news_title_translate_en: Epidemic response group says starts work on 3 possible China virus vaccines
news_title_translate_cn: 疫情应对小组称已开始研究3种可能的中国病毒疫苗
news_content_translate_en:
LONDON, Jan 23 (Reuters) - Three separate research teams are to start work on developing potential vaccines against the new coronavirus that is causing a disease epidemic in China, a global coalition set up to fight diseases said on Thursday.
The Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), which is co-funding the emergency projects, said the plan was to have at least one potential vaccine in clinical trials by June.
The research will be conducted by the drug and vaccine developer, Moderna, working with the U.S. National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, the U.S. firm Inovio Pharma, and a team at the University of Queensland, Australia.
A new coronavirus that first appeared in the Chinese city of Wuhan has killed 17 people and infected more than 600, most in China but cases have been detected as far away as the United States.
Each of the three projects will test a distinct scientific approach to developing a preventative vaccine against the China virus, known as nCoV-2019.
“Our aspiration with these technologies is to bring a new pathogen from gene sequence to clinical testing in 16 weeks,” said Richard Hatchett, CEPI’s chief executive.
“There are no guarantees of success, but we hope this work could provide a significant and important step forward in developing a vaccine for this disease.” (Reporting by Kate Kelland; Editing by Alex Richardson)
news_content_translate_cn:
路透伦敦1月23日电---周四成立的全球抗击疾病联盟表示，三个独立的研究小组将着手研发新型冠状病毒（coronavirus）的疫苗，该病毒正在中国引发疾病流行。
共同资助这些紧急项目的流行病预防创新联盟（CEPI）表示，该计划将在6月前至少有一种潜在的疫苗进入临床试验。
这项研究将由药物和疫苗开发商Moderna与美国国家过敏和传染病研究所、美国Inovio Pharma公司和澳大利亚昆士兰大学的一个团队合作进行。
一种最早出现在中国武汉市的新型冠状病毒已造成17人死亡，600多人感染，其中大部分在中国，但病例已被发现远在美国。
这三个项目将分别测试一种独特的科学方法，以开发一种针对中国病毒的预防性疫苗，即nCoV-2019。
CEPI首席执行官理查德哈切特（richardhachett）说：“我们对这些技术的渴望是在16周内将一种新的病原体从基因序列带到临床测试中。”。
“没有成功的保证，但我们希望这项工作能为研制这种疾病的疫苗向前迈出重要的一步。”

The local transport network are kept closed from 10:00 (local time) on Thursday. Also, the airport and the railway stations of Wuhan also be open for passengers.
The National Health Commission of the China believes that this disease, which has already killed more than 500 infected, could mutate and spread, since it is transmitted through the respiratory tract. Assigned to the new coronavirus pneumonia is not associated with special symptoms: patients have fever, while some suffer breathing difficulties and X-rays show changes in the lungs.
This viral disease is not cured with antibiotics and treatment is symptomatic, without focusing on the etiology of evil.

news_title_translate_en: Macau denies entry and exit of fever patients to help contain coronavirus outbreak
news_title_translate_cn: 澳门拒绝发热病人出入境协助控制冠状病毒爆发
news_content_translate_en:
Macau is refusing on the borders the entry and exit of people with fever to contain the outbreak of the Chinese Wuhan virus that has already caused 17 deaths and more than half a thousand infected.
Up to now, body temperature measurements were being carried out at the border entrance, but orders are now to carry out the same exit check, information which was underlined this Thursday at two press conferences, a first one promoted by the head of government, a second one at the end of the afternoon, provided by the health authorities.
The head of government explained at the beginning of the afternoon that this procedure is already being followed in the neighbouring city of Zhuhai and that Macao's decision is to reinforce the joint effort to contain the epidemic that has already led to the identification of infected people in South Korea, Japan, Thailand, United States, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macao.

澳门拒绝发烧人士出入境，以控制中国武汉病毒的爆发，该病毒已造成17人死亡，5000多人感染。
到目前为止，在边境入口处进行体温测量，但现在命令进行同样的出境检查，本周四在两次新闻发布会上强调了这一点，第一次是政府首脑推动的，第二次是在下午结束时，由卫生部门提供。

news_title_translate_en: A virus, Xi Jinping's new test
news_title_translate_cn: 一个病毒，习近平的新考验
news_content_translate_en:
Wuhan Huanggang and other cities are now closed to plague (version 2.0)
The latest number of infections reported by Chinese state media is 634, and the death toll is still 17, which has not continued to rise compared with the previous day. However, the news about the actual number of people infected with pneumonia in Wuhan is much more than that reported by the official. It is even reported that the actual number of people infected in Wuhan is tens of thousands. Fever clinics in major hospitals are full of people, and many doctors who are infected cannot be confirmed.
In the face of the almost out of control epidemic, Wuhan officials also took extreme measures after being criticized for the disastrous information transparency, and announced the ban on "closing the city" to 11 million residents. Since 10:00 a.m. on Thursday, the city's buses, subways, ferries and long-distance passenger transport have been completely stopped, and the citizens are not allowed to leave Wuhan without special reasons. The airport, railway station and other pipelines to leave China are temporarily suspended Closed, recovery time to be announced separately. It reappears the terrible scene described in the famous French writer Camus' plague.
This time, Wuhan pneumonia not only revealed that the Chinese did not learn from the SARS epidemic in 2003, but also continued to hunt and kill the wild animals that were carrying the deadly virus and were forbidden to be sold. At the same time, it also showed to the world the institutional defects that the relevant departments of China still had no improvement in the information transparency and emergency response measures for epidemic diseases.
According to the latest report, Huanggang City, Ezhou City and Chibi City have all taken the same measures after the closure of Wuhan, reflecting the severity of the coronavirus epidemic.
Xi Jinping's supreme directive is late.
It has been reported that the initial outbreak of pneumonia in Wuhan was on December 8. However, since December 31, a document "emergency notice on reporting the treatment of pneumonia of unknown causes" was circulated on the Internet by Wuhan health institutions on the first day. After disclosure, the authorities finally came forward to confirm and began to report the cases to the society, which means that they are trying to find out what kind of pneumonia it is.
However, the delay in time and the opacity of information have led to the weak awareness of vigilance and prevention of the public and medical institutions. In a short time, the invisible virus has quietly gone through the process of animal to animal transmission, and then evolved into human to human transmission. With the people leaving Wuhan, it has spread to the whole country and other parts of the world.
Chinese President Xi Jinping issued the highest directive in January on 19, calling for "maintaining overall social stability". We need to do a good job in epidemic prevention to prevent the spread of the epidemic. Outside analysis thinks, Xi Jinping's speech is to the new coronavirus spread situation serious confirmation.
。 After the instruction was issued, the official disease information and statistics were released one by one, and the Wuhan government immediately made a ban on "closing the city". However, all this happened more than a month after the first case.
Heavy consumption impact on the economy
According to Agence France-Presse analysis, the Chinese Communist Party's regime has just been criticized for 7 years of protests in Hongkong, the criticism and condemnation of the international community's policies towards Xinjiang's ethnic minorities, and the exhaustion of China's trade war. The black swan flying out of Wuhan at the end of the new year is undoubtedly a new test for Xi Jinping.
Apart from such a major medical challenge as the threat to human life, can China's economy still be hurt? China's export, one of the pillars of the economy, has been damaged by Trump's high tax on total products. Facing the lowest economic growth rate in thirty years in 2018, Beijing hopes to stimulate economic development with domestic consumption. However, the emergence of the new virus is likely to hit the heart of China's economic growth, and tourism is the first to bear the brunt.
But AFP also pointed out that the SARS storm, which killed 774 people in the world in 2002-2003, caused a short-term slowdown in China's economic growth and limited impact. In 2003, thanks to the great profits brought by the export recovery, the economic growth achieved a brilliant result of 10%. But 17 years later, China has turned from the world factory to the second largest economy in the world. The regime led by Xi Jinping not only shows its strong strength to the whole world, but also shows the wild heart of the economic power that shows the responsible person in the face of the unpredictable Trump regime. But because of this, the current situation of China's economy is facing greater challenges. Will it be able to get through the difficulties as well as the SARS storm?
Can the government continue to play the role of "savior"?
Agence France-Presse reported that although it was late, but after Xi Jinping's highest directive was issued, China's health and propaganda departments immediately mobilized and took measures to let the government play the role of "rescuers" in the world and a country in charge of controlling the situation in the world. And if Xi Jinping's intervention can be controlled in the short term after decisive intervention, his credibility will increase correspondingly.
According to the official website of the Ministry of foreign affairs of China, Xi Jinping and Merkel and Ma Long on the 22 day, respectively, on the phone, the two leaders expressed concern about the epidemic of pneumonia in Wuhan.
。
Reported that Merkel responded to the Chinese timely response to the new coronavirus infection pneumonia, kept open and transparent, and actively carried out international cooperation to be commended. France and Germany both expressed their willingness to strengthen health cooperation with China.
Ironically, on the occasion of the campaign of dealing with the new coronavirus in the whole world and even the whole world, the front page of the official media "people's Daily" in January 23rd highlighted the reports of the central leaders visiting the old comrades, as well as Xi Jinping's telephone conversation with the leaders of France and Germany. The atmosphere was peaceful. On the other hand, the New York Times put Wuhan pneumonia report in the center of the front page. It is clear at a glance which is more important or less important.
Some netizens said angrily: let's remember this humiliating day.

武汉黄冈等市封城现《鼠疫》2.0版
中国官媒最新报道的感染人数为634人，死亡人士依然是17人，与前一天相比没有继续上升。但是，有关武汉肺炎感染人数实际比官方报道多得多的消息在网上不断发酵，甚至传出武汉实际感染人数上万，各大医院发烧门诊人满为患，许多医生被感染的无法得到证实的说法。
面对几乎失控的疫情，武汉官方也在灾难性的信息透明度受到谴责后，采取了极端的措施，宣布对1千1百万居民下了“封城”禁令，自周四上午10时开始，全市城市公车、地铁、渡轮及长途客运全面停驶，市民无特殊原因不得离开武汉，机场、火车站等离汉管道暂时封闭，恢复时间另行通告。再现法国著名作家加缪名作《鼠疫》中描述的可怕情景。
这次武汉肺炎不仅再次暴露出中国人没有汲取2003点非典疫情的教训，继续猎杀饕餮携带致命病毒，禁止贩卖的野生动物的恶习，而同时也将中国有关部门在流行疾病的信息透明度和紧急应对措施上也依然毫无改进的制度弊病展示到世人面前。
据最新报道，武汉采取封城措施后，黄冈市，鄂州市和赤壁市都已经采取了同样的措施，侧面反映出此次冠状病毒疫情之严重程度。
习近平最高指示姗姗来迟
有报道称，这次武汉肺炎最初与12月8号爆发，而直到12月31日起，网上流传一份武汉卫生机构头日“关于报送不明原因肺炎救治情况的紧急通知”文件，披露后，当局才最终出面证实，才开始向社会通报病例，并指正在查清是何种肺炎。
但时间上的延误，信息不透明，都导致民众和医疗机构的警戒和防范意识薄弱，看不见的病毒就这样在短时间内悄悄地经历了动物间传染，传染给人类，进而进化为人传人，随着离开武汉的人群传播到全国和世界上其他地方的过程。
中国国家主席习近平1月19发出了相关最高指示，要求“维护社会大局稳定”。要求做好防疫工作，防止疫情扩散蔓延。外界分析认为，习近平的讲话是对新冠状病毒蔓延局势严重的证实。指示下达之后，官方的疾病信息和统计数据才一一出台，武汉政府也随即做出了“封城”禁令。然而，这一切都是在首例病例出现一个多月之后。
重创消费对经济造成影响
法新社分析指出，中国共产党政权刚刚被已经持续了7个月的香港反修例抗议浪潮，国际社会对新疆少数民族政策的批评和谴责，以及中国贸易战搞得疲惫不堪，在年关之际，从武汉飞出来的这只“黑天鹅”对习近平来说无疑是个新的考验。
除了对人生命的威胁这样的重大医疗挑战外，中国经济还能伤得起吗？中国经济支柱之一出口，已经受到特朗普对总过产品加征高税的破坏，面对2018年的经济增长率为三十年来最低点，北京及希望于国内的消费来刺激经济发展，但新的病毒的出现很可能让中国的经济增长心脏受到重创，首当其冲的就是旅游业。
但法新社也指出，2002-2003年导致全球774人死亡的萨斯风暴导致中国经济增速短期放缓，影响面也有限。2003年借助出口恢复带来的宏利，经济增速获得10%的亮丽成绩。但17年后的今天，中国已经从世界工厂华丽转身成为全球第二大经济体，习近平领导的政权不仅向全世界展示其雄厚的实力，也显示出面对难以揣测的特朗普政权而展示出负责人的经济大国的野心。但正因如此，中国经济目前局势面临着更大的挑战，是否能与当年萨斯风暴一样，能顺利度过难关成为关注的焦点之一？
政府能继续扮演“拯救者”？
法新社报道指出，虽然姗姗来迟，但在习近平的最高指示下达以后，中国的卫生和宣传部门都立即动员了起来，采取措施，让政府扮演起对内是“拯救者”，在国际上是一个负责人能够控制局面的国家的角色。而如果在习近平具有决定意义的干预之后，病毒传染可以在短期内得到控制的话，他的可信度也就会相应增加。
据中国外交部官网，习近平在22日分别应约与默克尔和马克龙通电话，两国领导人对武汉肺炎疫情表达了关切。
报道称，默克尔对中方及时应对新型冠状病毒感染肺炎疫情，保持公开透明，并积极开展国际合作予以赞赏。法德两国均表示，愿和中方加强卫生合作。
而具有讽刺意味的是，在全民甚至全世界都进入应对新冠状病毒战役之际，1月23号的官媒《人民日报》头版突出的是中央领导看望老同志，以及习近平与法德领导人同电话的报道。气氛一片祥和。与此对应的是，当天的《纽约时报》却将武汉肺炎报道放到了头版中心位置。孰重孰轻，一目了然。
有网友就此愤慨的说：让我们记住这个耻辱的日子。

news_content_translate_en:
"It takes a lot of bad luck," Lusa tells Hubei Chufeng Heli's goalkeeper coach, who competes in the third Chinese football division. I came on Wednesday from the pre-season internship in Kunming (southwest China), just to pick up my bags, and this morning I was notified I couldn't leave town", he says.
"Highways, rail and air links, everything's closed," he describes. We can't get out of here,"he adds.
Authorities have banned the entry and exit of Wuhan and two other neighbouring towns, for an indefinite period, in a de facto quarantine that caught millions of people off guard on the eve of the start of the Lunar New Year holiday.
The main feast of Chinese families, equivalent to Christmas in Western countries, is also the largest internal migration on the planet: according to the Chinese Ministry of Transport there will be a total of three billion domestic journeys over the next forty days.
Antonio Rosa, professor of Design and Art at an international school in Wuhan, was also caught by surprise: "I had been on vacation for several days, but I was waiting for my girlfriend's holiday, starting on Friday, so that we could travel together to Vietnam".
"If you knew what I know today, you wouldn't be here," you tell Lusa.
The virus was initially detected last month in a shellfish market in the suburbs of Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province, which is also an important domestic and international transport centre, but has spread to several Chinese provinces.
The disease has been identified as a new type of coronavirus, similar to atypical pneumonia, or Severe Acute Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), which between 2002 and 2003 killed 650 people in mainland China and Hong Kong
Yeah.
Initially the Chinese authorities only reported 41 patients, all in Wuhan, and ruled out that the disease was transmissible among humans, but the number of infected increased rapidly this week and reached today the 571, distributed by 25 Chinese provinces, and killed 17 people.
Miguel Matos tells us that in Wuhan, the seventh largest city in China, with 11 million inhabitants, silence is "total", with the "closed establishments and empty streets".
After notification of authorities, vegetables and other goods sold out quickly in the city supermarkets as households accumulate supplies. In petrol stations, long queues also formed along the day.
"We went shopping because we didn't have anything in the house, but we've only been able to buy some meat," Coach says.
Antonio Rosa reveals that the masks, whose use is recommended by the authorities to prevent the contagion, have been depleted quickly in Wuhan's stores, and there are those who are taking advantage of them now for four times the original price.
The professor says that, for the time being, the quarantine situation will hold, but that if it lasts for weeks it will be "impossible".
Miguel Matos says he does not know how long the quarantine will be in force, but reveals that officials at a local hospital have informed him that it can be extended until the end of March. "What I am told is that there is no over-zeal, but that the situation is really serious", he says.
Images broadcast on Chinese social networks show city hospitals swarming with people who chained them to do clinical analysis. Long queues also formed at the airport and train station as residents attempted to leave Wuhan.
According to Lusa Agency estimates, six Portuguese people live in Wuhan.
The city also hosts dozens of Angolan and other Portuguese-speaking students each year at Wuhan University, one of the largest in the country in the field of engineering.

news_title_translate_en: Wuhan virus: Epidemic response group says starts work on 3 possible vaccines
news_title_translate_cn: 武汉病毒：疫情应对小组称开始研究3种可能的疫苗
news_content_translate_en:
LONDON (REUTERS) - Three separate research teams backed by a global coalition set up to fight epidemic diseases are to start work on developing potential vaccines against the new coronavirus that has caused a disease outbreak in China. 
 Developing new vaccines has traditionally taken up to a decade, but the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI), which is funding two of the projects and co-funding the third, said the aim now is to work much faster. 
 Its plan is to have at least one potential vaccine in clinical trials by June, offering the chance that a shot could fully developed, tested and approved for use in a year. 
 The research will be conducted by drug and vaccine developer Moderna working with the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases; the US firm Inovio Pharma; and a team at the University of Queensland, Australia. 
 The new coronavirus, known as nCoV-2019, first appeared in the Chinese city of Wuhan but cases have been detected as far away as the United States. 
 It has killed 17 people and infected more than 600. 
 Each of the three projects will test a distinct scientific approach to developing a preventative vaccine. 
 “Our aspiration with these technologies is to bring a new pathogen from gene sequence to clinical testing in 16 weeks,” said Richard Hatchett, CEPI’s chief executive. 
 “There are no guarantees of success, but we hope this work could provide a significant and important step forward in developing a vaccine for this disease.”  
 CEPI’s hope is to enable vaccine platform technology that has already been advanced for other infectious diseases such as Mers and Ebola to be used to hasten progress, Hatchett said. 
 Vaccine platforms are based on using the same fundamental components as a framework, and adapting them for use against different pathogens by inserting new gene sequences
. 
 Infectious disease epidemics such as Ebola outbreaks in Africa, the Zika outbreak that spread from Brazil, and the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (Mers) outbreak, are sporadic, unpredictable and fast-moving. 
 Yet developing vaccines to combat them has traditionally taken up to 10 years or more. 
 CEPI was set up at the start of 2017 with the aim of dramatically speeding up the process of developing of vaccines against new and unknown diseases.
news_content_translate_cn:

传统上，开发新疫苗需要长达10年的时间，但为其中两个项目提供资金、为第三个项目提供共同资金的防疫创新联盟（CEPI）表示，现在的目标是更快地开展工作。
它的计划是在6月份之前至少有一种潜在的疫苗在临床试验中，提供一种疫苗在一年内完全开发、测试和批准使用的机会。
这项研究将由药物和疫苗开发商摩德纳（Moderna）与美国国家过敏和传染病研究所、美国Inovio制药公司以及澳大利亚昆士兰大学（University of昆士兰）的一个团队合作进行。
这种新型冠状病毒名为nCoV-2019，最早出现在中国武汉市，但最远在美国发现病例。
已经造成17人死亡，600多人感染。
这三个项目中的每一个都将测试开发预防性疫苗的独特科学方法。
CEPI首席执行官理查德哈切特（richardhachett）说：“我们对这些技术的渴望是在16周内将一种新的病原体从基因序列带到临床测试中。”。
“没有成功的保证，但我们希望这项工作能够为研制这种疾病的疫苗向前迈出重要的一步。”
哈切特说，CEPI的希望是能够利用已经为Mers和埃博拉等其他传染病先进的疫苗平台技术来加快进展。
疫苗平台的基础是使用与框架相同的基本组件，并通过插入新的基因序列使它们适应不同的病原体
.
非洲埃博拉疫情、巴西兹卡疫情、中东呼吸综合征疫情等传染病疫情具有突发性、不可预测性和快速性。
然而，传统上，研制疫苗来对抗它们需要10年或更长时间。
CEPI成立于2017年初，旨在显著加快针对新的和未知疾病的疫苗开发进程。

news_title_translate_en: Beijing puts second city under coronavirus lockdown, cancels New Year events
news_title_translate_cn: 北京将第二城市纳入冠状病毒禁闭，取消新年活动
news_content_translate_en:
Residents in Wuhan, a city of 11 million people, were told on Thursday not to leave "without a special reason" and most transport was suspended.
Hours later, neighbouring Huanggang, a city of about 6 million people was placed under a similar lockdown, with flights and trains cancelled. Buses, subways and ferries have been suspended.
Health officials are scrambling to contain the pneumonia-like virus that has already spread to other countries including Singapore, which on Thursday confirmed its first case.
Large-scale Lunar New Year events in Beijing have been cancelled and people have been advised to avoid crowded places over the busy Spring Festival.
The city government said it would call off events including temple fairs that usually draw shoulder-to-shoulder crowds, and the Forbidden City, a popular tourist attraction in the heart of the capital, will close starting on Saturday.
Growing panic
In China's seventh biggest city Wuhan, the epicentre of the outbreak, residents said a sense of fear was growing as the city went into lockdown.
"We feel as though it is the end of the world," said one Wuhan resident on China's Twitter-like Weibo platform, voicing concerns about shortages of food and disinfectant.
"We really need everyone's help."
Another described being on the "verge of tears" when the de facto quarantine was announced, with the misery compounded by it coming on the eve of the Lunar New Year holiday.
Wuhan's train station and airport, which should have been packed with people coming travelling for holiday family reunions, were almost empty except for workers on Thursday afternoon.
WHO to meet
Few people were seen in the streets of the city and all were wearing masks
.
The respiratory virus has claimed 17 lives since emerging from a seafood and animal market in Wuhan, infected nearly 600 other people nationwide and been detected as far away as the United States
The Geneva-based World Health Organization said it would hold an emergency meeting Wednesday night to decide whether to designate the outbreak as an international public health emergency.
Meanwhile, the railway station in a third nearby city, Ezhou, which has a population of over one million, will also close from tonight.
French response
As airports around the world increase health screenings and monitor flights arriving from China, France has announced that all international airports in the country are to provide passengers with information on the coronavirus and its symptoms.
Health minister Agnès Buzyn has confirmed that so far no suspected cases of the coronavirus have been reported.

As he pointed economist Zhang Ming, the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences -the main think tank state Sino, speaking collecting magazine Caijing, the growth of GDP in the first quarter of this year could be reduced by one percentage point stand at 5% or less, because the break because of the virus.

A quick calculation suggests that if spending on these services fell by 10%, total GDP growth would fall by about 1.2 percentage points, "said S & P consulting firm Global Ratings in a note.
Early indications are not encouraging. In its reopening after the holidays, shares in the Hong Kong Stock Exchange have fallen by 2.4%. Due to the closure of major chains and the suspension of big premieres, New Year, when they usually break box office records, revenue in theaters was only 1.81 million yuan, or about 250,000 euros, according to the company ticketing Maoyan. Is a drop of 99% over the previous year.
"It is a certainty that the outbreak of coronavirus have an impact on economic growth this quarter," notes Mark Williams of Capital Economics in a note. Compared with SARS, "while the official response this time more transparent and active it can be proved most effective in containing the virus also can make greater initial economic damage".
Much of this damage could correspond to the broad sector of the Chinese underground economy, represented by migrants to urban areas. Back in the field to spend the holidays with their families, many have been surprised by quarantine or have been altered your travel plans. Prolonged break from their jobs may leave them with no income while it lasts.
"After SARS, China adopted an expansionary fiscal policy, including tax cuts, to help the recovery of the sectors most affected," said Tianlei Huang, of the Peterson Institute for International Economics (PIIE). "This time, China has large fiscal deficits and therefore has less space to implement fiscal stimulus then. In monetary policy, the central bank may increase liquidity support, but there will be credit-driven stimulus. "
The key point to analysts, will be in the speed with which the crisis is resolved. "Depending on how the crisis is reduced, and especially how they manage the Chinese government-not in small measure how transparent sea-, the cost could exacerbate the decline in Chinese growth," said Huang.

这些天的不活动和不确定性给了中国一种奇怪的梦游空气。几乎没有车辆或人在街上行走。超过4 600万人被隔离了很多交通工具都停用了在教育机构中的课程，在另行通知之前取消。商店关门了。武汉冠心病已造成170人死亡，7 800多人感染，有可能至少在短期内对我国经济产生深远影响，我国经济几十年来增长率已经下降了6.1%。
正如中国社会科学院的经济学家张明——中国最大的国家智囊团——在《清静》杂志发表的声明中所指出的那样，今年第一季度国内生产总值的增长可以下降一个百分点，达到5%或更低。因为病毒导致的眼球。
这些天，中国的城市看起来像巨大的沙漠。电影院，博物馆，旅游景点都被取消了大多数商店仍然关闭；开着商店的人戴着面具，除了卖杂货的人之外，其他人几乎没有什么活动。许多餐馆都不愿意重开，尽管在正常情况下，这将是出纳日：现在公众避免拥挤的地方。在苏州工业中心，工厂在2月8日之前不得重新开放。在上海，公司至少要到9号才能恢复营业。
除了消费之外，受限制措施影响最大的部门是运输。除了封锁吴汉所在的省份湖北的大部分地区——感染的源头——之外，我们还建议尽可能避免流离失所。机场本应是一年中最繁忙的时期，现在基本上是空的。
否长程公共汽车和高速火车的路线已经瘫痪。与旅游业者的出国旅行已经暂停。根据政府的官方数据，与2019年的新月日期相比，运输量下降了28.8%。在铁路部门，下降幅度高达41.5%。在飞机上，41.6%。
情况不能再糟了。中国的新年就像圣诞节或西方的黑色星期五一样，是消费支出最高的一年，在中国国内生产总值中占有越来越大的比重。由于需求疲软，加上美中贸易战的冲击，经济增长率下降了6.1%，达到30年来的最低水平。
Natxis投资银行亚洲首席经济学家Alicia Garcia-Herrero解释说，“冠状动脉对中国经济的影响可能比非典大得多”。García-Herrero先生提到，2003年，在广州（中国南部）的一个市场上爆发的冠状动脉瘤综合症在全世界造成了近800人死亡，这也是同一家庭的冠状动脉瘤引起的。
当时，这一流行病使中国第二季度的增长率降低了一个百分点，为9.1%。零售价下跌了一半。虽然对经济的打击只是暂时性的，但在随后的季度里，增长率恢复到10%以上。
但是，Garcia-Herrero指出，“中国比2003年更加依赖消费，而且消费肯定会减慢”。除了奢侈品和耐用品外，还有旅馆业：“许多部门都将受到影响，这些部门对中国增长的重要性远远高于2003年，当时外部需求是关键所在”。
否
“在中国，到2019年，消费占国内生产总值的实际总增长率约3.5个百分点。快速计算表明，如果这些服务的支出下降10%，国内生产总值的总增长将下降约1.2个百分点”，咨询公司《全球比率》在一份说明中指出。
最初的迹象并不令人鼓舞。在度假后重新开张时，香港证券交易所的股票下跌了2.4%。由于主要连锁店关闭和大型首映会在新年通常打破票房记录时暂停发行，根据毛岩门票公司的资料，电影院的收藏品仅为181万元，约为25万欧元。这比前一年下降了99%。
资本经济公司的马克·威廉斯在一篇文章中说，“很肯定冠状动脉瘤的爆发将对本季度的经济增长产生影响”。与严重急性呼吸系统综合症相比，“这一次，官方反应更加透明和积极，可以在遏制病毒方面表现得更为有效，但也可能加剧最初的经济损失”。
这些损害大部分可能与中国广大的非正规经济部门有关，主要是城市移民。许多人回到乡下与家人一起度过节日，他们要么被隔离，要么旅行计划被改变。长期失业可能使他们在整个就业期间失去收入。
皮特森国际经济研究所（PIIE）的Tianlei Huang指出，“非典之后，中国采取了扩张性财政政策，包括减税，以帮助受影响最严重的部门复苏”。“这一次，中国财政赤字巨大，财政刺激的空间比当时小。
否在货币政策方面，中央银行可以增加流动资金支持，但不会有信贷驱动的刺激措施。”
分析家们指出，关键在于迅速解决这场危机。黄人豪说，“取决于如何缓解危机，特别是中国政府如何管理危机，而不是如何透明，代价可能会加剧中国增长的下降”。

Wuhan coronavirus has claimed its first fatality outside China, the Philippines, while in China the number of cured (331), according to official figures, exceeds that of deaths (304).
2019-nCoV coronavirus can cause pneumonia with symptoms such as high fever, dry cough, headache and shortness of breath. Its average incubation period is three to seven days, with a maximum of 14 Chinese scientists have confirmed that, unlike SARS, it is possible contagion during incubation. WHO has declared an international emergency outbreak.
The Philippines has reported the first death outside China coronavirus. He is a man of 44 years of Chinese nationality who died Saturday. It was the companion of a 38 year-old also infected, who had come to the archipelago from Wuhan after a stopover in Hong Kong.
The announcement, confirmed by the World Health Organization (WHO), comes after hours of the Philippines has issued a temporary ban on entry to the country for travelers who have passed through mainland China, Hong Kong or Macao for the last fourteen days the maximum incubation time of the virus.
The pathogen has already reached almost thirty countries almost everyone, where 150 cases have been detected. Only South America and Africa remain free of infection.
In the country of origin of the epidemic, the death toll continues to climb. The dead are already 304, according to data from provincial health commissions, although the figure is already beginning to surpass it recovered 331 patients have already been discharged.
14,411 are infected, while another 19,544 suspected cases. In total remains under observation to 137,594 people who have been in contact with the sick.
Chinese authorities have ordered today road closures and restrictions of movement in the city of Wenzhou (nine million), the first city in which this measure outside Hubei Province, the epicenter of the epidemic coronavirus is taken. It is recommended that citizens remain in their homes and leave only if an emergency arises. In addition, the city can only leave a member of the family every two days, whenever a case of necessity.
While continuing the spread of the coronavirus, the Chinese government has confirmed an outbreak of H5N1 avian influenza on a farm in Hunan Province, bordering Hubei, Wuhan is located. In this farm, in the rural outskirts of the city of Shaoyang, they were killed 4,500 of its 8,000 chickens due to illness. Authorities have culled nearly 18,000 poultry.
So far the outbreak has not infected anyone. H5N1 avian influenza is a serious respiratory disease for birds. Transmission to humans often occurs among people who have had much contact with these animals for a long time. Although the spread between people is possible, it is unusual.
The mortality rate of avian flu is very high, exceeding 50%, over 11% of the Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS), which killed nearly 800 people worldwide in 2003, or the new coronavirus, which until the moment has about 2%.

The people rise up against imperialism
"We in the world are the vanguard of the new model that humanity will build to overcome the wild and neoliberal capitalism", emphasized the constitutional president of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela, Nicolas Maduro Moros, on Friday at the close of the World Conference against The imperialism. For three days (22, 23 and 24) attendees installed 72 thematic and sectoral tables, with the aim of joint action strategies against the fascist practices, which the US government and its lackeys seek to globalize an economic system that denies large majorities the full enjoyment of their most basic human rights. More than 350,000 people marched Friday in Paris to demand the government withdraw its retirement reform, said the General Confederation of Labor (CGT), one of the organizers of the mobilization. With banners, flags and balloons giants, workers from various sectors, students and pensioners took a tour from the Place de la Republique to Concorde, amid a large police presence, but no significant incidents. Accompanied by music and slogans against the government, particularly against President Emmanuel Macron, protesters said their determination remains intact in rejecting the initiative, having met Friday 51 days from the start of a strike to pressure the executive. news_title_translate_en: Chinese doctor who 1st warned about coronavirus outbreak dies
news_title_translate_cn: 首次警告冠状病毒爆发的中国医生死亡
news_content_translate_en:
Chinese doctor Li Wenliang, one of the eight whistle-blowers who warned other medics of the coronavirus outbreak but were reprimanded by the police, died of the epidemic on Thursday, official media reported.

Li, a 34-year-old doctor who tried to warn other medics of the epidemic, died of coronavirus on Thursday in Wuhan, the state-run Global Times reported.
He was the first to report about the virus way back in December last year when it first emerged in Wuhan, the provincial capital of China's central Hubei province.
He dropped a bombshell in his medical school alumni group on the popular Chinese messaging app WeChat that seven patients from a local seafood market had been diagnosed with a SARS-like illness and quarantined in his hospital.
Li explained that, according to a test he had seen, the illness was a coronavirus -- a large family of viruses that includes severe acute respiratory syndrome which led to 800 death in China and the world in 2003.
Li told his friends to warn their loved ones privately.
But within hours screenshots of his messages had gone viral, without his name being blurred.
"When I saw them circulating online, I realised that it was out of my control and I would probably be punished," Li was quoted as saying CNN recently.
Soon after he posted the message, Li was accused of rumour-mongering by the Wuhan police.
He was one of several medics targeted by the police for trying to blow the whistle on the deadly virus in the early weeks of the outbreak.
Overall 564 people have died in China due to the virus and 28,018 confirmed cases have been reported from 31 provincial-level regions, the National Health Commission reported on Thursday.
news_content_translate_cn:
据官方媒体报道，中国医生李文良是8名告密者之一，他曾警告其他医护人员冠状病毒爆发，但遭到警方训斥，于周四死于该流行病。
据官方媒体《环球时报》报道，34岁的李医生于本周四在武汉死于冠状病毒，他曾试图提醒其他医生注意这一流行病。
早在去年12月，当病毒首次在中国中部湖北省的省会武汉出现时，他就是第一个报道这种病毒的人。
他在自己的医学院校友团中，在中国流行的信息应用微信（WeChat）上投下一枚炸弹，称当地一家海鲜市场的7名患者被诊断患有类似SARS的疾病，并被隔离在自己的医院。
李解释说，根据他所看到的一项测试，这种疾病是一种冠状病毒——一个包括严重急性呼吸综合征在内的病毒大家族，2003年在中国和世界上导致800人死亡。
李告诉他的朋友们私下里要警告他们的亲人。
但在几个小时内，他的信息截图就在网上疯传，他的名字也没有被模糊。
“当我看到他们在网上流传时，我意识到这是我无法控制的，我可能会受到惩罚，”李娜最近在接受美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）采访时说。
在他发布这条信息后不久，李被武汉警方指控散布谣言。
在病毒爆发的最初几周，他是几名因试图揭发致命病毒而被警方锁定的医护人员之一。
据国家卫生委员会14日报道，全国共有564人死于该病毒，31个省级地区共报告28018例确诊病例。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus testing facility likely at Mumbai hospital
news_title_translate_cn: 可能在孟买医院的冠状病毒检测设施
news_content_translate_en:
The Maharashtra government is mulling to set up a coronavirus testing facility at Kasturba Hospital here to reduce the burden on Pune-based National Institute of Virology (NIV) which is currently handling such samples from across the country, an official said on Tuesday.
An additional testing facility at the civic-run hospital here will help in getting faster results, the senior state health official said.
"The plan is being discussed to share some load of NIV. The institute is getting swab samples from across the country for testing of novel coronavirus infection. If a similar testing facility is set up in Mumbai, it will minimise the waiting period," she said.
More and more samples are being received for testing at NIV, hence it is better to set up an additional examination facility in Mumbai at the earliest, the official said.
"Health officials have communicated their views to higher authorities about setting up a coronavirus testing facility in Mumbai. We will come to know about it in the coming days," she added.
As of now, six patients have been kept in observation wards at various hospitals in the state. Of these, four are in Pune, and one each in Mumbai and Sangli district, another official said on Monday.
Since January 18, state health officials have screened 8,878 passengers at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport for the coronavirus infection, he said.
No confirmed case of the deadly virus, which has killed 425 people in China till now, has been detected yet in Maharashtra.
The coronavirus is a large family of viruses that cause illnesses ranging from common cold to acute respiratory syndromes, but the virus that has killed people in China is a novel strain and not seen before.
Common symptoms of the novel coronavirus strain include respiratory problems like cough, shortness of breath and fever, according to the World Health Organisation
.
The WHO has declared the coronavirus epidemic as a global health emergency.
The virus - which first emerged in Wuhan city in China's central Hubei province - has spread to 25 countries, including India (three confirmed cases have been reported from Kerala), the US and the UK.
news_content_translate_cn:
马哈拉施特拉邦政府的一位官员周二说，马哈拉施特拉邦政府正在考虑在喀土巴医院建立一个冠状病毒检测设施，以减轻总部位于普纳的国家病毒学研究所（NIV）的负担，该研究所目前正在处理来自全国各地的此类样本。
该州高级卫生官员说，在这家民办医院增设一个检测设施，将有助于更快地取得结果。
“这个计划正在讨论，以分担一些国家免疫联盟的负荷。该研究所正在从全国各地获取拭子样本，用于检测新型冠状病毒感染。如果在孟买建立类似的检测设施，将使等待时间最小化，”她说。
这位官员说，越来越多的样本被送到NIV进行检测，因此最好尽早在孟买增设一个检测设施。
卫生官员已经向上级当局传达了他们对在孟买建立冠状病毒检测设施的看法。我们将在未来几天内了解此事，”她补充道。
截至目前，该州各医院的观察病房共收治了6名患者。另一名官员周一说，其中四个在普纳，孟买和桑利区各一个。
他说，自1月18日以来，国家卫生官员已经在孟买的Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj国际机场对8878名乘客进行了冠状病毒感染筛查。
马哈拉施特拉邦至今尚未发现已造成425人死亡的致命病毒确诊病例。
冠状病毒是引起普通感冒和急性呼吸综合征等疾病的一个大家族病毒，但在中国致死的病毒是一种新病毒，以前从未见过。
据世界卫生组织称，这种新型冠状病毒株的常见症状包括咳嗽、呼吸急促和发烧等呼吸系统问题
.
世卫组织宣布冠状病毒疫情为全球卫生紧急事件。
该病毒最初出现在中国中部湖北省武汉市，现已传播到25个国家，包括印度（喀拉拉邦已报告3例确诊病例）、美国和英国。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus: India suspends e-visa for travellers coming from China
news_title_translate_cn: 冠状病毒：印度暂停为来自中国的旅客提供电子签证
news_content_translate_en:
India on Sunday temporarily suspended e-visa facility for Chinese travellers and foreigners residing in China in view of the virulent coronavirus that has killed more than 300 people, infected 14,562 others and spread to 25 countries, including India, the US and the UK.
"Due to certain current developments, travel to India on e-visas stands temporarily suspended with immediate effect," the Indian Embassy announced here.
"This applies to holders of Chinese passports and applicants of other nationalities residing in the People's Republic of China. Holders of already issued e-visas may note that these are no longer valid," the announcement said.
"All those who have a compelling reason to visit India may contact the Embassy of India in Beijing or the Indian consulates in Shanghai or Guangzhou, as well as the Indian Visa Application Centres in these cities," it said.
On Sunday, India airlifted a second batch of 323 stranded Indians and seven Maldivian citizens from coronavirus-hit Wuhan city, taking the total number of people evacuated to 654.
Air India's jumbo B747 made two flights to Wuhan city - the ground zero of the coronavirus epidemic. In the first flight on early Saturday, 324 Indians were evacuated and on Sunday another 323 Indians and seven Maldivian citizens were flown back.
news_content_translate_cn:
印度周日暂时暂停为中国旅客和在华外国人提供电子签证服务，因为这一致命的冠状病毒已造成300多人死亡，14562人感染，并蔓延至印度、美国和英国等25个国家。
印度大使馆在这里宣布：“由于目前的某些事态发展，持电子签证前往印度的旅行暂时暂停，并立即生效。”。
“这适用于持有中国护照的人和居住在中华人民共和国的其他国籍的申请人。已经签发的电子签证持有者可能会注意到这些签证不再有效。
它说：“所有有充分理由访问印度的人都可以联系印度驻北京大使馆或印度驻上海或广州领事馆，以及这些城市的印度签证申请中心。”。
周日，印度从武汉市空运了第二批323名滞留的印度人和7名马尔代夫公民，使总疏散人数达到654人。
印度航空公司的大型客机B747两度飞往武汉市，这是冠状病毒疫情的地面零点。在周六早些时候的第一次飞行中，324名印度人被疏散，周日又有323名印度人和7名马尔代夫公民被空运回国。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus outbreak: Air India special flight to evacuate Indian citizens from China's Wuhan today
news_title_translate_cn: 冠状病毒爆发：今天印度航空公司专机从中国武汉撤离印度公民
news_content_translate_en:
An Air India special B747 flight will depart today from Delhi for Wuhan city in China's Hubei province (China) for the evacuation of Indians amid the coronavirus outbreak that has caused worldwide panic. The special flight will depart from Delhi at 12:30 pm on Friday.
India had kept a 423-seater jumbo plane ready for evacuating Indian citizens from Wuhan city in China in the wake of coronavirus outbreak, an official source had said on Tuesday.
However, official permission from China is yet to come for the Air India aircraft which is to depart from Delhi at 12:30 pm. India is expecting the green signal at the earliest.
The evacuation comes a day India reported its first case of the coronavirus in Kerala. The student who tested positive for Coronavirus belongs to Kerala and was studying in Wuhan city in Hubei province of China, the epicentre of the deadly virus.
The government had on Friday reached out to over 600 Indians living in China's Hubei province to ascertain their willingness to be brought back to India.
Meanwhile, the death toll in China's novel coronavirus outbreak has climbed to 213 with the number of confirmed cases totalling to 9,692, China's national authorities announced on Friday.
The United Nations (UN) health agency, World Health Organisation (WHO), on Thursday, declared an international emergency over the deadly novel coronavirus that has originated from China. The international emergency is a rarely used designation that could lead to improved international co-ordination in tackling the disease.
(With inputs from Geeta Mohan and agencies)
news_content_translate_cn:
印度航空公司一架B747专机将于今天从德里起飞，飞往中国湖北省武汉市，在全球恐慌的冠状病毒爆发中撤离印度人。特别航班将于星期五下午12:30从德里起飞。
一位官方消息人士周二称，在冠状病毒爆发后，印度已准备好一架423座的大型客机，准备从中国武汉市撤离印度公民。
不过，印度航空公司将于下午12:30从德里起飞的飞机尚未得到中国的正式许可。印度最早预计到绿色信号。
在撤离前一天，印度报告了在喀拉拉邦发现的第一例冠状病毒病例。这名冠状病毒检测呈阳性的学生属于喀拉拉邦，当时在致命病毒的震中湖北省武汉市学习。
上周五，政府已经联系了600多名居住在中国湖北省的印度人，以确定他们是否愿意被带回印度。
与此同时，中国国家有关部门周五宣布，中国新型冠状病毒疫情死亡人数已攀升至213人，确诊病例总数达9692人。
联合国（UN）卫生机构世界卫生组织（WHO）周四宣布，因源自中国的致命新型冠状病毒而进入国际紧急状态。国际紧急情况是一个很少使用的名称，可能会导致在处理该疾病方面改善国际协调。
（由Geeta Mohan和其他机构提供）

news_title_translate_en: Two more coronavirus suspects admitted to Delhi's RML
news_title_translate_cn: 又有两名冠状病毒嫌疑犯进入德里的RML
news_content_translate_en:
Amid fears of novel coronavirus, two more suspected cases of coronavirus have come to Delhi's Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital, that makes a total of 8 suspected cases which are admitted to the hospital. The samples of the two suspected cases have been sent for testing.
Speaking to news agency IANS, RML's PRO Smriti Tiwari said: "Two more people suspected to be infected with coronavirus have been admitted to the Hospital. Their samples have been sent for testing."
She also said that a total of 8 suspected cases of coronavirus are currently at the RML hospital. "Two males, aging 23-year and 46-year olds have been admitted to the hospital today. One was staying in China for the last 5 years and returned from there on January 24 from Wuhan while the other visited China for 2 months and returned on January 18."
There were a total of 6 suspected cases as on January 30, including 4 males, 1 female and an one old admission. The 24-year old female suspected patient had been residing in China since 2015. She returned on January 29. While others were staying in China for as long as 7 years. Some of them were in China for over two months, informed Tiwari.
The dreaded virus started spreading from China's Wuhan city. Chinese authorities on Saturday announced that the death toll in the country has increased to 259, with 11,791 infected cases in 31 provincial-level regions.
Earlier, a double decker jumbo 747 with 15 cabin crew and five cockpit crew ferried back 324 Indian nationals. After the Air India evacuated Indians from Wuhan, the national carrier said another flight will depart to Wuhan on Saturday.
India has set up a coronavirus quarantine facility at Haryana's Manesar, with the help of the Army, for around 300 students arriving from China's Wuhan
.
Another quarantine facility for approximately 600 Indian families arriving from Wuhan has been swiftly created by the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) near its Chhawla camp here.
Responding to an emergency requirement to create and manage a facility to quarantine the returning Indians, the Indian Army has swiftly set up the camp.
news_content_translate_cn:
在人们对新型冠状病毒的担忧中，又有两名冠状病毒疑似病例来到德里的拉姆·马诺哈尔·洛希亚医生医院，这家医院共收治了8名疑似病例。两个疑似病例的样本已送去化验。
RML的亲Smriti Tiwari在接受IANS通讯社采访时说：“又有两名疑似感染冠状病毒的人被送进了医院。他们的样品已送检。”
她还说，目前RML医院共有8例疑似冠状病毒病例。”两名男性，年龄分别为23岁和46岁，已于今日入院。一个在中国呆了5年，1月24日从武汉返回，另一个在中国呆了2个月，1月18日返回。”
截至1月30日，共有6例疑似病例，其中男4例，女1例，老1例。这名24岁的女性疑似患者自2015年以来一直居住在中国。她于1月29日回来。而其他人则在中国待了7年之久。他们中的一些人在中国呆了两个多月，蒂瓦里说。

早些时候，一架载有15名机组人员和5名驾驶舱人员的双层巨型747客机运回324名印度国民。印度航空公司从武汉撤离印度人后，国家航空公司表示，周六将有另一架航班飞往武汉。
印度在军队的帮助下，在哈里亚纳马内萨尔建立了一个冠状病毒隔离设施，供大约300名来自中国武汉的学生使用
.
另一个来自武汉的大约600个印度家庭的检疫设施迅速被印度西藏边境警察（IBP）在其附近的Chanala营地附近创建。

news_title_translate_en: India reaches out to over 600 Indians in coronavirus-hit Hubei province
news_title_translate_cn: 在冠状病毒肆虐的湖北省，印度向600多名印度人伸出援手
news_content_translate_en:
The government has reached out to over 600 Indians living in China's Hubei province, the epicentre of coronavirus, to ascertain their willingness to be brought back to India.
India has already approached Chinese authorities to allow it to send two flights to Wuhan, the capital of Hubei, to bring back Indian nationals from the province.
"We have established contact with over 600 Indians across the province and are individually ascertaining their willingness to be repatriated. Our Mission in Beijing is working round-the-clock on the ground to work out the necessary logistics," External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Raveesh Kumar said at a media briefing.
He said the government has been conducting a regular review of the situation arising out of the outbreak of coronavirus in China.
The Indian embassy in Beijing said India was preparing to evacuate its citizens from Wuhan on Friday.
According to Chinese authorities, the nationwide death toll from novel coronavirus has jumped to 170.
"We have made a formal request to the government of China for bringing back Indian nationals from the Hubei province in two flights. We are awaiting for the necessary approval from the Chinese side. We hope this will be granted soon," Kumar said.
Kumar said arrangements are being put in place for people to travel to the airport in Wuhan.
"We remain committed to the safety and well-being of our nationals abroad. We appreciate the support extended by the government of China and other ministries in government of India in putting this process together," Kumar said.
news_content_translate_cn:
政府已经联系了600多名居住在中国湖北省的印度人，以确定他们是否愿意被带回印度。
印度已经与中国当局接洽，允许其派遣两架航班前往湖北省省会武汉，从该省带回印度公民。
“我们已经与全省600多名印度人建立了联系，并正在个别确定他们是否愿意遣返。外交部发言人库马尔（ravesh Kumar）在一次媒体吹风会上说：“我们在北京的任务是在当地24小时工作，以制定必要的后勤保障。”。
他说，政府一直在对中国爆发冠状病毒引起的情况进行定期审查。
印度驻北京大使馆表示，印度正准备在周五从武汉撤离其公民。
据中国当局称，全国范围内新型冠状病毒死亡人数已跃升至170人。
“我们已向中国政府提出正式请求，要求用两架航班从湖北省带回印度公民。我们正在等待中国方面的必要批准。库马尔说：“我们希望这很快能得到批准。
库马尔说，目前正在安排人们前往武汉机场。
“我们仍然致力于维护海外国民的安全和福祉。库马尔说：“我们感谢中国政府和印度政府其他部委在整合这一进程方面给予的支持。”。

news_title_translate_en: Amul's new ad on coronavirus outbreak divides Twitter. In bad taste, says Sona Mohapatra
news_title_translate_cn: 阿穆尔关于冠状病毒爆发的新广告在推特上引起了分歧。索娜·莫哈帕特拉说，品味很差
news_content_translate_en:
Amul's new topical advertisement on the coronavirus outbreak has triggered a debate on Twitter with a section of the internet slamming the brand for their approach. The advert features Indians being evacuated from China through two Air-India flights.
"Wuhan Se Yahaan Le Aaye," reads the tagline of the ad that has divided Twitter in its opinion of it. Wuhan is the epicentre of the outbreak of the novel coronavirus that has killed over 300.
The Amul girl, along with a group of other people - wearing masks - walked out of the flight in the cartoon that was shared by the brand on their social media accounts.
While several quarters appreciated Amul for their "creativity", some users also criticised the brand. "Oh come on, Amul," a user said while singer Sona Mohapatra said that the advert was in "bad taste".
It is in bad taste. Aur kahan leke jaate. Bharat mein hi laate na.
Amul... Har cheez mein taang adaaye !
Oh, c'mon Amul
Most others, though, were in support of Amul:
Awesome advertisement! Hats off to this creativity!
Classic, classic, classic
whats bad in this?
Air India's second special flight to Wuhan, landed in Delhi with 323 Indians and seven Maldivian citizens onboard on Sunday while the first Air India flight brought back 324 Indians stranded in Wuhan on Saturday. Meanwhile, two cases of coronavirus were confirmed In Kerala last week.
Chinese health authorities on Thursday said that it has received reports of 3,694 new confirmed cases of coronavirus and 73 deaths on Wednesday from 31 provincial-level regions and the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps.
news_content_translate_cn:
阿穆尔关于冠状病毒爆发的最新主题广告在推特上引发了一场争论，一部分互联网人士抨击该品牌的做法。这则广告的主要内容是印度航空公司的两架航班将印度人从中国撤离。
“武汉seyahaanleaaye”这则广告的标语是Twitter对它的看法有分歧的。武汉是新型冠状病毒爆发的震中，已造成300多人死亡。
这个阿穆尔女孩和其他一些戴着面具的人一起，在他们的社交媒体账户上分享了这个品牌的卡通形象，走出了飞机。
虽然有几个季度的用户赞赏Amul的“创造力”，但也有一些用户批评Amul的品牌“哦，来吧，阿穆尔，”一个用户说，而歌手索娜莫哈帕特拉说，广告是在“坏品味”。
味道不好。奥尔·卡恩·莱克·贾特。巴拉特·梅因·拉特·纳。
阿穆尔。。。哈齐兹·梅恩·塔昂·阿达耶！
哦，来吧阿穆尔
不过，其他大多数人都支持阿穆尔：
棒极了的广告！向这个创意致敬！
经典，经典，经典
这里面有什么不好的？
印度航空公司飞往武汉的第二架专机星期天在德里降落，机上有323名印度人和7名马尔代夫公民，而印度航空公司的第一架专机星期六带回了滞留在武汉的324名印度人。同时，上周在喀拉拉邦发现了两例冠状病毒。
中国卫生部门星期四说，他们星期三收到来自31个省级地区和新疆生产建设兵团的3694例新的冠状病毒确诊病例和73例死亡报告。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus outbreak: Cocktail of flu, HIV drugs appears to help fight virus, say Thai doctors
news_title_translate_cn: 冠状病毒爆发：泰国医生说，流感、艾滋病药物的混合物似乎有助于抗击病毒
news_content_translate_en:
Thai doctors have seen success in treating severe cases of the new coronavirus with combination of medications for flu and HIV, with initial results showing vast improvement 48 hours after applying the treatment, they said on Sunday.
The doctors from Rajavithi Hospital in Bangkok said a new approach in coronavirus treatment had improved the condition of several patients under their care, including one 70-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan who tested positive for the coronavirus for 10 days.
The drug treatment includes a mixture of anti-HIV drugs lopinavir and ritonavir, in combination with flu drug oseltamivir in large doses.
"This is not the cure, but the patient's condition has vastly improved. From testing positive for 10 days under our care, after applying this combination of medicine the test result became negative within 48 hours," Dr. Kriangska Atipornwanich, a lung specialist at Rajavithi, told reporters.
"The outlook is good but we still have to do more study to determine that this can be a standard treatment."
Chinese health officials have already been administering the HIV and flu drugs to fight the coronavirus. The use of the three together in a cocktail seemed to improve the treatment, the Thai doctors said.
Another doctor said that a similar approach in two other patients resulted in one displaying some allergic reaction but the other showed improvement.
"We have been following international practices, but the doctor increased the dosage of one of the drugs," said Somsak Akkslim, director-general of the Medical Services Department, referring to the flu medicine Oseltamivir.
Thailand has recorded 19 cases of coronavirus. Of the Thai patients, eight have recovered and gone home while 11 are still under treatment in hospitals
.
Somsak said the health ministry will meet on Monday to discuss the successful treatment in the case of the 70-year-old but said it is still too soon to say that this approach can be applied to all cases. "Initially we will apply this approach only to severe cases," he said.
news_content_translate_cn:
泰国医生在星期天说，他们已经成功地用治疗流感和艾滋病的药物治疗了这种新型冠状病毒的严重病例，初步结果显示，在应用这种疗法48小时后，病情有了很大改善。
曼谷拉贾维希医院的医生说，一种新的冠状病毒治疗方法改善了他们所照顾的几个病人的状况，其中一名来自武汉的70岁中国妇女在10天内检测出冠状病毒阳性。
药物治疗包括抗HIV药物洛匹那韦和利托那韦的混合物，以及大剂量的流感药物奥司他韦。
“这不是治愈的方法，但病人的情况已经大大改善了。拉贾维蒂的肺专家Kriangska Atipornwanich博士告诉记者：“在我们的护理下，从检测10天呈阳性开始，在使用这种药物组合后，检测结果在48小时内呈阴性。”。
“前景不错，但我们仍需做更多研究，以确定这是一种标准的治疗方法。”
中国卫生官员已经开始使用HIV和流感药物来对抗冠状病毒。泰国医生说，在鸡尾酒中同时使用这三种药物似乎能改善治疗效果。
另一位医生说，在另外两名患者身上采用类似的方法，一名患者出现了一些过敏反应，但另一名患者则有所改善。
“我们一直在遵循国际惯例，但医生增加了其中一种药物的剂量，”医疗服务部主任索姆萨克·阿克斯林（Somsak Akkslim）说，他指的是流感药物奥司他韦。
泰国已记录到19例冠状病毒病例。在泰国病人中，8人已经康复回家，11人仍在医院接受治疗
.
索姆萨克说，卫生部将于周一召开会议，讨论对这位70岁老人的成功治疗，但他说，现在说这种方法可以适用于所有病例还为时过早。”最初，我们将只对严重病例采用这种方法。”。

news_title_translate_en: UPDATE 2-Euro zone bond yields keep multi-month lows in sight
news_title_translate_cn: 最新消息2-欧元区债券收益率保持多月低点在望
news_content_translate_en:
* Bond yields inch up from over 3-month lows
* But mood in bond markets remains cautious
* Focus on economic fallout from coronavirus
* Euro zone periphery government bond yields tmsnrt.rs/2ii2Bqr (Updates prices, adds latest Brexit developments)
By Dhara Ranasinghe
LONDON, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Euro zone bond yields inched up on Monday but remained within sight of multi-month lows in a sign that bond investors remain cautious as they assess the economic repercussions from the spread of a coronavirus.
Chinese markets sold off sharply on Monday, the first trading session after an extended Lunar New Year break. But this was mostly a product of selling pressure that had built up over the holiday and not a reflection of new market fears, analysts said.
In a sign of a slightly more positive tone in world markets, European shares rallied and the safe-haven yen and Swiss franc weakened.
Yields on benchmark 10-year government bonds were a touch higher across the currency bloc, but remained within sight of the lows hit on Friday - reflecting a generally cautious tone among investors.
Germany’s 10-year Bund yield was just one basis point higher on the day at -0.44%, hovering near more than three-month lows hit at the end of last week.
Yields on German 30-year government bond yields are at 0.07% and less than 10 bps away from negative yield territory.
“Chinese authorities have shown they have the strength and will to protect their markets and that has probably fed through to a stabilisation, but ultimately this (coronavirus) remains a complete unknown quantity and nobody knows how long it will go on for and what the impact will be on a human and economic scale,” said Rabobank rates strategist Matt Cairns.
“That will continue to push down safe-haven yields until we know that it’s under control
.”
China’s central bank unexpectedly lowered the interest rates on reverse repurchase agreements by 10 bps on Monday, as authorities stepped up measures to relieve pressure on the economy from the rapidly spreading virus outbreak.
European Central Bank vice president Luis de Guindos said the ECB sees early signs of stabilisation in the global economy but cautioned that the coronavirus outbreak is creating uncertainty.
Investors have started to ratchet up expectations for an ECB rate cut by year-end, with markets pricing in more than a 60% chance of a 10 bps cut by year-end.
“Over the coming days, investors are likely to upgrade their estimates of the expected economic fallout related to 2019-nCov (coronavirus),” analysts at UniCredit said in a note.
“As long as the increase in the number of cases does not flatten perceptibly, market sentiment will most probably remain under pressure.”
Renewed uncertainty over Britain’s future relations with the European Union also limited the rise in euro zone bond yields.
The European Union and Britain clashed over a post-Brexit trade deal on Monday. The two sides set out very different visions of a future relationship that could result in the most distant of ties.
news_content_translate_cn:
*债券收益率从3个多月低点小幅上升
*但债券市场的情绪依然谨慎
*关注冠状病毒对经济的影响
＊欧元区外围政府债券收益率TMSNR.RS/2II2BQR（更新价格，增加最新的BrxIT发展）
作者：达拉·拉纳辛赫
路透伦敦2月3日电---欧元区公债收益率周一小幅上升，但仍在数月低点附近，显示债券投资者在评估冠状病毒蔓延对经济的影响时仍保持谨慎。
中国股市周一大跌，这是农历新年长假后的第一个交易日。但分析师表示，这主要是假日期间累积的销售压力造成的，并不是市场新担忧的反映。
欧洲股市反弹，避险货币日元和瑞士法郎走软，显示全球市场的基调稍显积极。
基准10年期政府债券收益率在整个欧元区略有上升，但仍在周五触及的低点附近，反映出投资者普遍持谨慎态度。
德国10年期国债收益率当日仅上涨1个基点，至-0.44%，徘徊在上周底创下的逾三个月低点附近。
德国30年期政府债券收益率为0.07%，距离负收益率区间不到10个基点。
“中国当局已经表明，他们有实力和意愿保护自己的市场，这可能已经促成了稳定，但最终这种病毒（冠状病毒）的数量还是个未知数，没有人知道它会持续多久，对人类和经济规模会产生什么影响，荷兰合作银行利率策略师马特凯恩斯说。
“这将继续压低避险收益率，直到我们知道它在控制之中。”
.”
中国央行周一出人意料地将逆回购协议的利率下调了10个基点，因为当局加强了措施，以缓解迅速蔓延的病毒爆发给经济带来的压力。
欧洲央行副行长路易斯德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，欧洲央行看到了全球经济企稳的早期迹象，但警告称，冠状病毒疫情正在制造不确定性。
投资者已开始提高对欧洲央行年底降息的预期，市场预计年底降息10个基点的可能性超过60%。
联合信贷银行（UniCredit）分析师在一份报告中称：“未来几天，投资者可能会上调对2019年nCov（冠状病毒）相关预期经济影响的预估。”。
“只要案件数量的增长不明显平缓，市场情绪很可能仍将承压。”
英国与欧盟未来关系再度出现不确定性，也限制了欧元区债券收益率的上升。
欧盟和英国星期一就一项BrxIT贸易协议发生冲突。双方对未来的关系提出了非常不同的看法，这可能导致最遥远的关系。

news_title_translate_en: UPDATE 11-Oil falls 1% as Russia needs time to mull more OPEC+ supply cuts
news_title_translate_cn: 最新消息11日石油价格下跌1%，因俄罗斯需要时间考虑更多欧佩克+供应削减
news_content_translate_en:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Oil prices fell 1% on Friday as Russia said it needed more time before committing to output cuts sought by other large producers while the coronavirus outbreak fanned worries about global crude demand.
Oil prices posted their fifth straight weekly decline, as speculators have backed away due to weaker consumption figures and expectations that the coronavirus, which has killed more than 600 people, will remain a drag on demand.
Brent crude LCOc1 futures lost 46 cents, or 0.8%, to settle at $54.47 a barrel. Brent sank 6.3% for the week.
U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures CLc1 fell 63 cents, or 1.2%, to settle at $50.32 a barrel. The contract lost 2.4% for the week.
This week, a panel advising OPEC+, the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and allies led by Russia, suggested provisionally cutting output by 600,000 barrels per day (bpd).
On Friday, Russia Energy Minister Alexander Novak said Moscow needed more time to assess the situation.
“Russia’s lack of commitment thus far to such a deal is providing one additional bearish element that is currently precluding the complex from sustaining price advances,” Jim Ritterbusch, president of Ritterbusch and Associates, said in a note.
Prices have fallen about a fifth since the outbreak of the virus in the Chinese city of Wuhan. China is the world’s biggest importer of crude, taking in roughly 10 million bpd in 2019.
Novak predicted global oil demand may fall by 150,000 to 200,000 barrels per day (bpd) in 2020 in part because of the virus.
The OPEC+ group this year deepened existing cuts to roughly 1.7 million bpd, nearly 2% of global demand, yet prices have remained in a narrow band. Producers in OPEC+ are scheduled to meet in Vienna on March 5-6, although the meeting could be brought forward because of concerns surrounding the virus
.
Forecaster Eurasia Group said it estimates a contraction in oil demand in China of as much 3 million bpd in the first quarter from 2019 levels.
U.S. Energy Secretary Dan Brouillette said on Friday that the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on global energy markets is currently marginal, though it could worsen if the virus spreads.
Sources have told Reuters that Chinese policymakers are preparing measures, including more fiscal spending and interest rate cuts, amid expectations that the outbreak will have a devastating impact on first-quarter growth.
(GRAPHIC: Change in Brent crude oil prices since Jan. 20 - here)
U.S. energy firms added oil rigs for the third time in four weeks even though producers planned to continue reducing spending on new drilling for a second consecutive year in 2020. Companies added 1 oil rig in the week to Feb. 7, bringing the total count to 676, energy services firm Baker Hughes Co BRK.N said on Friday. RIG-OL-USA-BHI
Money managers cut their net long U.S. crude futures and options positions in the week to Feb. 4 by 55,512 contracts to 162,518, the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) said on Friday.

油价连续第五周下跌，由于消费数据走弱，投机者纷纷退却，并预计造成600多人死亡的冠状病毒仍将拖累需求。
布伦特原油LCOc1期货下跌46美分，收于每桶54.47美元，跌幅0.8%。布伦特原油本周下跌6.3%。
U、 美国西德克萨斯中质原油期货CLc1下跌63美分，收于每桶50.32美元，跌幅1.2%。这周合同损失了2.4%。
本周，以俄罗斯为首的石油输出国组织（欧佩克）和盟国欧佩克建议暂时减产60万桶/日。

news_title_translate_en: Scientists question work suggesting pangolin coronavirus link
news_title_translate_cn: 科学家质疑认为穿山甲冠状病毒与
news_content_translate_en:
LONDON/BEIJING (Reuters) - Independent scientists questioned research on Friday that suggested that the outbreak of coronavirus disease spreading from China might have passed from bats to humans through the illegal traffic of pangolins.
South China Agricultural University, which said it had led the research, said on its website that the “discovery will be of great significance for the prevention and control of the origin (of the new virus)”.
China’s official Xinhua news agency reported that the genome sequence of the novel coronavirus strain separated from pangolins in the study was 99% identical to that from infected people. It said the research had found pangolins - the world’s only scaly mammals - to be “the most likely intermediate host.”
But James Wood, head of the veterinary medicine department at Britain’s University of Cambridge, said the research was far from robust.
“The evidence for the potential involvement of pangolins in the outbreak has not been published, other than by a university press release. This is not scientific evidence,” he said.
“Simply reporting detection of viral RNA with sequence similarity of more than 99% is not sufficient. Could these results have been caused by contamination from a highly infected environment?”
Pangolins are one of Asia’s most trafficked mammals, despite laws banning the trade, because their meat is considered a delicacy in countries such as China and their scales are used in traditional medicine.
The outbreak of disease caused by the new coronavirus, which has killed 636 people in mainland China, is believed to have started in a market in the city of Wuhan that also sold live wild animals.
Virus experts think it may have originated in bats and then passed to humans, possibly via another species
.
Jonathan Ball, a professor of molecular virology at Britain’s University of Nottingham, said that while the South China Agricultural University research was an interesting development, it was still unclear “whether or not the endangered pangolin really is the reservoir”.
“We would need to see all of the genetic data to get a feel for how related the human and pangolin viruses are, and also gain an understanding of how prevalent this virus is in pangolins and whether or not these were being sold in the Wuhan wet markets,” he said.
Dirk Pfeiffer, a professor of veterinary medicine at Hong Kong’s City University, also said the research was a long way from establishing a link between pangolins and the new coronavirus outbreak in humans.
“You can only draw more definitive conclusions if you compare prevalence (of the coronavirus) between different species based on representative samples, which these almost certainly are not,” he said.
news_content_translate_cn:
伦敦/北京（路透社）-周五，独立科学家对研究提出质疑，认为从中国传播的冠状病毒疾病可能是通过非法贩卖穿山甲从蝙蝠传染给人类的。
华南农业大学在其网站上说，这一发现对于预防和控制（新病毒）的起源具有重要意义。
中国官方的新华社报道说，研究中从穿山甲分离出的新型冠状病毒株的基因组序列与感染者的基因组序列完全相同。它说，研究发现穿山甲是“最有可能的中间宿主”，穿山甲是世界上唯一的有鳞哺乳动物
但英国剑桥大学兽医系主任詹姆斯伍德（James Wood）表示，这项研究远远不够有力。
“关于穿山甲可能参与此次疫情的证据，除了一份大学新闻稿外，尚未公布。这不是科学证据。”。
“仅仅报告序列相似性超过99%的病毒RNA的检测是不够的。这些结果可能是由高度受感染的环境造成的吗？”
穿山甲是亚洲被贩卖最多的哺乳动物之一，尽管法律禁止这种贸易，因为在中国等国家，穿山甲的肉被认为是美味佳肴，它们的鳞片被用于传统医学。
这种新型冠状病毒在中国大陆已造成636人死亡，据信是在武汉市的一个市场爆发的，该市场也销售活的野生动物。
病毒专家认为它可能起源于蝙蝠，然后通过其他物种传给人类
.
英国诺丁汉大学（University of Nottingham）分子病毒学教授乔纳森·鲍尔（Jonathan Ball）表示，虽然华南农业大学的研究是一个有趣的进展，但“濒危穿山甲是否真的是水库”仍不清楚。
他说：“我们需要查看所有的基因数据，以了解人类和穿山甲病毒之间的关系，同时了解这种病毒在穿山甲中的流行程度，以及这些病毒是否在武汉湿货市场销售。”。
香港城市大学兽医学教授Dirk Pfeiffer也表示，这项研究对于建立穿山甲和人类新冠状病毒爆发之间的联系还有很长的路要走。
他说：“只有根据代表性样本比较不同物种之间（冠状病毒）的流行率，才能得出更明确的结论，而这些样本几乎肯定不是。”。
